comment.author: 38445623@N00
comment._content:
Brother-in-law, a long time ranger, and director of exhibits at the Grand Canyon says " It's the broken-off flowering stalk of a century plant, looks like Utah agave. "

David

comment.author: 25053835@N03
comment._content:
It is possible that the plant was Agave utahensis Engelm., but without a close-up picture, it is difficult to be sure.
Field book project posting on behalf of
Christian Feuillet, Department of Botany, NMNH

comment.author: 25053835@N03
comment._content:
Are these not in order that they were taken?  It would help to see what was just before and just after it.  
Field Book Project posting on behalf of
Vicki Funk, Department of Botany, NMNH
